sentences.en: " I got dressed before luncheon,'said the child, turning eagerly to Daisy.
sentences.cn: “ 我在午饭前就打扮好了. ” 孩子说, 急切地把脸转向黛西.

sentences.en: " You two start on home, Daisy,'said Tom. " In Mr. Gatsby's car. "
sentences.cn: “ 你们两人动身回家, 黛西, ” 汤姆说, “ 坐盖茨比先生的车子. ”

sentences.en: " You're just embarrassed , that's all, " and luckily I added: " Daisy's embarrassed too. "
sentences.cn: “ 你不过是难为情罢了, 没别的. ” 幸好我又补了一句, “ 黛西也难为情. ”

sentences.en: "Listen," said Daisy, digging into her oatmeal.
sentences.cn: “听着，”黛西一边大口喝着燕麦粥一边说道。

sentences.en: A breeze stirred the gray haze of Daisy's fur collar.
sentences.cn: 一阵微风吹动了黛西的毛茸茸的灰皮领子.

sentences.en: A crisp white blouse was paired with a slim single-fold black pencil skirt with a daisy for daytime sophistication.
sentences.cn: 一件轻薄的白色宽松上衣，搭配细长的绣着雏菊的黑色单层铅笔裙作为混搭日装。

sentences.en: Daisy called her daffy, but goodhearted.
sentences.cn: 黛西说她傻乎乎的，但心肠很好。

sentences.en: Daisy was smiling sweetly at him.
He spoke as if Daisy's reaction was the only thing that mattered.
sentences.cn: 他这样说,仿佛黛西的反应是唯一要紧的事情.

sentences.en: He woke up as fresh as a daisy after his long sleep.
sentences.cn: 他睡了一大觉起来,显得精神饱满.

sentences.en: My new car is simply a daisy.
Racing up the stairs, he almost collided with Daisy.
sentences.cn: 他飞奔上楼，差点撞到黛西。

sentences.en: The little daisy was as happy as if the day had been a great holiday, but it was only Monday.
sentences.cn: 小雏菊快乐得就像在过一个不寻常的假日，但这天只是星期一。

sentences.en: Then it noticed the little daisy, and nodded to it, and kissed it with its beak and said: “You must also fade in here, poor little flower.
sentences.cn: 这时他注意到了那朵小雏菊，向她点头，吻了她并说：“你在这儿一定也会枯萎，可怜的小花儿。

sentences.en: There was a husky tenderness in his tone. " Daisy? "
sentences.cn: 他沙哑的声音流露着柔情, “ 黛西? ”

sentences.en: This fruit was picked only yesterday, it's as fresh as a daisy.
sentences.cn: 这水果是昨天才摘的,非常新鲜.

words.tran_cn: 雏菊；菊科植物；极好的东西

trans.tran_cn: 雏菊，菊科植物，<俚>名流，上等品
trans.tran_en: a white flower with a yellow centre
